alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 2:36AM PST until January 17 at 12:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST TUESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains above 5000 feet. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to noon PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will rise above 7000 feet this morning, then fall to around 5000 feet early this evening and 4000 feet on Tuesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
